page.title: List of men's major championships winning golfers

revision.text:
{{Short description|None}} The [[men's major golf championships]], also known simply as the majors, are the four most prestigious events in professional [[golf]].<ref> {{cite web | last = Harig | first = Bob | title = Golf's professional Grand Slam has developed over time | work = [[ESPN.com]] | date = 7 April 2008 | url = https://www.espn.com/golf/masters08/columns/story?columnist=harig_bob&id=3330050 | access-date =7 April 2008 }}</ref> The competitions are the [[Masters Tournament]], the [[PGA Championship]], the [[U.S. Open (golf)|U.S. Open]], and [[The Open Championship]], contested annually. [[File:JackNicklaus.cropped.jpg|thumb|275x275px|{{center|[[Jack Nicklaus]] won 18 men's major golf championships, more than any other man.}}]] [[Jack Nicklaus]] has won the most majors, achieving 18 victories during his career.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/sports/golf/pga/2006-08-20-pga-championship_x.htm | last = Dodd | first = Mike | title=Tiger cruises to 12th major title with easy win at PGA Championship |work=[[USA Today]] |date=21 August 2006 |access-date=24 October 2008 }}</ref> Second on the list is [[Tiger Woods]], who has won 15 majors to date; his most recent major victory was at the [[2019 Masters Tournament|2019 Masters]].<ref>{{cite web| last = Lillywhite | first = Jamie | url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/golf/7456559.stm |title=Woods seals dramatic US Open win |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |date=16 June 2008 |access-date=24 October 2008 }}</ref> [[Walter Hagen]] is third with 11 majors;<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.worldgolfhalloffame.org/walter-hagen/ |title=Walter Hagen profile |publisher=[[World Golf Hall of Fame]] |access-date=1 February 2016}}</ref> he and Nicklaus have both won the most PGA Championships with five.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pga.com/pgachampionship/2004/history_records.html |title=Championship Record Book |publisher=[[PGA Championship]] |access-date=22 September 2008 }}</ref> Nicklaus also holds the record for the most victories in the Masters, winning the tournament six times.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.masters.org/en_US/history/records/champions.html |title=Champions |publisher=[[Masters Tournament|Masters]] |access-date=21 January 2008 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080119012545/http://www.masters.org/en_US/history/records/champions.html |archive-date=19 January 2008 }}</ref> Additionally, Nicklaus shares the record for the most U.S. Open victories with [[Willie Anderson (golfer)|Willie Anderson]], [[Bobby Jones (golfer)|Bobby Jones]] and [[Ben Hogan]], each winning four times.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usopen.com/2007/history/usopen_records.html#champions |title=Champions |publisher=US Open.com |access-date=26 April 2008 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20080303210811/http://www.usopen.com/2007/history/usopen_records.html#champions |archive-date = 3 March 2008}}</ref> [[Harry Vardon]] holds the record for the most Open Championship victories, winning six times during his career.<ref>{{cite web| url = http://www.opengolf.com/en/History.aspx?activeItem=5&page=Do%20You%20Know#| title = Do You Know (Question 48)| publisher = [[The Open Championship]]| access-date = 8 April 2010| url-status = dead| archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20110806062418/http://www.opengolf.com/en/History.aspx?activeItem=5&page=Do%20You%20Know| archive-date = 6 August 2011}}</ref> Five men: Nicklaus, Woods, Hogan, [[Gary Player]] and [[Gene Sarazen]] are the only golfers to have won all four of the majors during their career,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.espn.com/golf/usopen14/story/_/id/11057314/career-grand-slam-grown-stature-golf |title=Career Grand Slam has grown in stature over time |work=ESPN |date=11 June 2014 |access-date=13 April 2015 |first=Bob |last=Harig }}</ref> thus achieving the ''[[Grand Slam (golf)|career grand slam]]''. Although the [[U.S. Amateur]] and [[The Amateur Championship]] were once considered to be majors,<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.golf.com/special-features/setting-new-standard-bobby-jones-wins-grand-slam-1930 |title=Setting a new standard: Bobby Jones wins the Grand Slam in 1930 |publisher=Golf.com |first=Damon |last=Hack |date=15 May 2008 |access-date=22 July 2013}}</ref> they are no longer recognized as such, and victories in these competitions are not included in the list.
To date, 470 majors have been played. A total of 233 different men have won majors and, of these, 89 have won at least two.
==By golfer== {| class="wikitable" |+Key |width="40px" align=center style="background-color:#cedff2"|{{asterisk}} |Completed a career Grand Slam |}

==Gallery== <gallery> File:Jenkins Medal Awards 2019 (49060017176) (cropped).jpg|[[Jack Nicklaus]] won a record 18 majors File:Tiger Woods drives by Allison.jpg|[[Tiger Woods]] has won 15 majors File:Walter Hagen 1914.png|[[Walter Hagen]] won 11 majors File:Ben Hogan NYWTS.jpg|[[Ben Hogan]] won nine majors File:All Black.jpg|[[Gary Player]] won nine majors File:2008 Open Championship - Tom Watson.jpg|[[Tom Watson (golfer)|Tom Watson]] won eight majors File:Bobby Jones c1921.jpg|[[Bobby Jones (golfer)|Bobby Jones]] won four [[U.S. Open (golf)|U.S. Open]]s and three [[The Open Championship|Open Championships]], for a total of seven majors File:YN3ArnoldPalmer.jpg|[[Arnold Palmer]] won seven majors File:Gene Sarazen.JPG|[[Gene Sarazen]] won seven majors File:Sam Snead 1967.JPG|[[Sam Snead]] won seven majors File:HarryVardon.jpg|[[Harry Vardon]] won [[The Open Championship]] a record six times, and won one [[U.S. Open (golf)|U.S. Open]], for a total of seven majors File:Nick Faldo.jpg|[[Nick Faldo]] won six majors File:PhilMickelsonTPC18thTee.jpg|[[Phil Mickelson]] has won six majors File:Seve Ballesteros 2006-07-19.jpg|[[Seve Ballesteros]] won five majors File:James Braid (golfer) 1913.jpg|[[James Braid (golfer)|James Braid]] won five majors File:JohnHenryTaylor.jpg|[[John Henry Taylor]] won five Open Championships File:WillieAnderson1909.jpg|[[Willie Anderson (golfer)|Willie Anderson]] won four U.S. Opens File:Old and Young Tom Morris.jpg|[[Tom Morris, Sr.]] and [[Tom Morris, Jr.]] both won four Open Championships File:Willie Park Senior wearing the Championship Belt.jpg|[[Willie Park, Sr.]] won four Open Championships </gallery>
